org.catechis.dto
Class WordTestDates

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.dto.WordTestDates

public class WordTestDates
extends java.lang.Object

This _bean_, like RatesOfFogetting has to do more than most. It requires even more inside its methods to handle the way we want to use this information.

There are reading, writing, and eventually speaking and listening types.

There are the number of allowed levels: now 0-3 (these should really be from the users options file)

Then there is a Hashtable of dates and Word objects.

We also need to access these objects sequentially by date, so an ArrayList of dates, which are the keys in the Hashtable is kept as well.

To make it easy to use, we want to provide all this funtionality.

Each word should be listed twice here (if it has been tested for reading and writing)

(Eventually we will add speaking and listening also)

Each word will have only one last test date, at a particular level.

The millisecond keys represent the lst test date of each word, reading or writing, represented in milliseconds to that they can be sorted and.

reading_wtd_milliseconds(0-3)= reading hastable keys in milliseconds.

writing_wtd_milliseconds(0-3)= writing hastable keys in milliseconds.

reading_wtd_hashes(0-3)= reading miilseconds key - word

writing_wtd_hashes(0-3)= writing miilseconds key - word

All the try catch blocks are needed to catch incomplete information, such as if there is no previous test, etc. They may not all be needed, but cuased a lot of problems while developing and testing the add method.

changeSpecificWordTestDate

public void changeSpecificWordTestDate(int old_level,
                                       int new_level,
                                       java.lang.String type,
                                       java.lang.String old_date_key,
                                       java.lang.String new_date)
Get the specific word, and then remove the old hashtable and arraylist entries, and add the new entry.

Notice that the new date argument is represtend as a date with the normal fromal we use, and not milliseconds like the old date key argument.

getSpecificWordTestMIllisecondsKey

public java.lang.String getSpecificWordTestMIllisecondsKey(java.lang.String type,
                                                           Word word)
This method can be used when we dont know the last test date of a particular word. So we have to cycle through all the words at all levels of a particular type. I would suggest to the developers to keep a copy of the last test dates inside the word object so that this method doesnt have to be called, as it is costly on resources.
